data.tip: A great way to build sight-word vocabulary in new readers.
data.description: 6 read-aloud storybooks and activities that help children explore the people around them - family, friends, pets, teachers, and the community.

lessons.title: Get Down, Rocky!
lessons.synopsis: When Rocky gets stuck on the roof of a church, Rose’s family and neighbours try to bring him down. Will they be able to rescue Rocky?
lessons.storyline: When Rocky gets stuck on the roof of a church, Rose’s family and neighbours try to bring him down. Will they be able to rescue Rocky?
lessons.discussion: This is a story about Rocky who gets stuck on the roof. Who is Rocky?
theme_activity: Ask the students to list out all the people mentioned in the book. Have them come up with three new ideas to get Rocky down from the roof. Also ask them what they would do if their pet was stuck on the roof.

lessons.title: Anand
lessons.synopsis: Meet Anand! He likes driving around and meeting new people. He likes music, dancing, and animals. He likes looking good, and he likes making your neighbourhood look good. He's awesome!
lessons.storyline: Anand likes driving around and meeting new people. He likes music, dancing, and animals. He likes looking good, and he likes making your neighbourhood look good. He's awesome!
lessons.discussion:
Who are the people you see around your house? 
Whom do you meet on the way to and from school?
theme_activity: Have the students sit in a circle and talk about their favourite person in the neighbourhood.

lessons.title: What's Ameena Up To?
lessons.synopsis:
Everyone’s wondering what Ameena is up to on a sleepy Sunday afternoon. After all, where did
the coconut shell, the paint, the buttons, and newspaper go?
lessons.storyline: Everyone’s wondering what Ameena is up to on a sleepy Sunday afternoon. After all, where did the coconut shell, the paint, the buttons, and newspaper go?
lessons.discussion:
What can you do with  a rubber band? 
What can you use a button for?
theme_activity: Divide the class into groups. Give them pieces of string, buttons, paper, and pebbles. Ask them to make something, and tell the rest of the class about it.
Ask the students to bring small items from around the house to class, and do a ‘show and tell’ of how they can use these things to make something.

lessons.title: Aaloo-Maaloo-Kaaloo
lessons.synopsis: One day Maloo had to get some potates from his grandmother's kitchen garden, but he could not find any. And then Kaloo helps him to uncover the hidden potatoes.
lessons.storyline: Maaloo has to get some potatoes (aloos) from his grandmother's kitchen garden, but he can’t find any. His pet, Kaaloo helps him to uncover the hidden potatoes!
lessons.discussion:
Do you think potatoes grow on trees? 
Where do they grow?
theme_activity: Ask the students to draw and colour their favourite fruits and vegetables.

lessons.title: Rani's First Day at School
lessons.synopsis: What does Rani see on her first day in school? How does she feel?
lessons.storyline: A book about a girl's first day at school, that talks about the people she meets and how she feels.
lessons.discussion:
How did you feel on your first day at school?
Whom did you meet?
theme_activity: Divide the class into groups of two. Ask each group to come up with two ideas to welcome a new student to school. For instance, show the new student around the school.

lessons.title: I Want That One!
lessons.synopsis: "Not that one," says Anil's mother when he asks for something. "Not that one!" say all the shopkeepers in the market too. That makes the little boy very angry indeed!
lessons.storyline: Anil visits the market with his mother. Read what happens there and whom he meets on his trip.
lessons.discussion:
Do you like going to the market? 
What do you always want to buy when you go shopping?
theme_activity: Arrange the students in a circle, and have them toss a ball to each other. When the ball comes to a student, they have to name something they buy from the market.
